properties.name: Glacier National Park
properties.description: A pristine wilderness preserve in northwestern Montana featuring rugged mountains, pristine forests, and over 700 miles of trails.

properties.name: Mount Rainier National Park
properties.description: An iconic peak of the Cascade Range featuring subalpine wildflower meadows, ancient forest groves, and glaciers surrounding the 14,411-foot stratovolcano.

properties.name: Crater Lake National Park
properties.description: Home to the deepest lake in the United States, formed 7,700 years ago by the collapse of the volcano Mount Mazama.

properties.name: Death Valley National Park
properties.description: The largest national park in the lower 48 states, featuring extreme desert landscapes, salt flats, sand dunes, and the lowest point in North America.

properties.name: Grand Canyon National Park
properties.description: One of the most spectacular examples of erosion anywhere in the world, carved by the Colorado River over millions of years.

properties.name: Arches National Park
properties.description: Home to over 2,000 natural stone arches, massive fins, and balanced rocks sculpted from red sandstone over millions of years.

properties.name: Grand Teton National Park
properties.description: Featuring the dramatic Teton Range rising abruptly from the valley floor, pristine lakes, and diverse wildlife in northwestern Wyoming.

properties.name: Yellowstone National Park
properties.description: The world's first national park, famous for its geothermal features including Old Faithful geyser, diverse wildlife, and pristine wilderness.

properties.name: Katmai National Park
properties.description: A pristine wilderness in Alaska famous for brown bears fishing for salmon at Brooks Falls and the Valley of Ten Thousand Smokes.

properties.name: Great Smoky Mountains National Park
properties.description: America's most visited national park, straddling Tennessee and North Carolina with ancient mountains, diverse wildlife, and rich cultural history.

properties.name: Antietam National Battlefield
properties.description: Site of the bloodiest single day in American military history during the Civil War, preserved to commemorate the Battle of Antietam fought on September 17, 1862.
